#Text=40th Ariane 5 rocket launches ProtoStar-1 and Badr-6 satellites
#Text=Monday , July 7 , 2008
#Text=An Ariane 5ECA rocket has successfully launched two satellites .

#Text=The European carrier rocket lifted off from ELA-3 ( Launch Area 3 ) at the Guiana Space Centre in French Guiana , South America , at 21:47 GMT this evening , carrying the ProtoStar-1 and Badr-6 spacecraft .
#Text=ProtoStar-1 is the first satellite to be operated by ProtoStar Corporation , a Bermuda -based US / Asian communications company .
#Text=It will be positioned at 98.5 째East longitude , in a geosynchronous orbit , around 36,000 kilometres above the Equator .
#Text=It was built by Space Systems Loral , based on the LS-1300 bus .
#Text=It will provide direct-to-home high definition broadcasting and internet services to South-East Asia .

#Text=The satellite was originally named ChinaSat-8 , and intended for launch on a Long March 3B carrier rocket by the Chinese satellite operator ChinaSat ; this was cancelled due to US ITAR export regulations , with the uncompleted satellite being transferred to ProtoStar .
#Text=Badr-6 will be operated by Arabsat , a Saudi Arabian company .
#Text=It will be positioned at 26 째East , from where it will be used to provide direct-to-home television broadcasting services to the Persian Gulf .
#Text=It was built by EADS Astrium and Thales Alenia Space , based on the Eurostar 2000+ bus .
#Text=Badr is Arabic for " full moon " .

column1: #Text=Badr-6 , which is also designated Arabsat-4C , was built to replace the Arabsat-4A satellite which was lost in a Proton launch failure during early 2006 .
#Text=A 17-metre long payload fairing was used to encapsulate the two satellites , and a Sylda dual-payload adapter , used to allow the rocket to carry two satellites .
#Text=There are several different types of adapter ; the Sylda-5 configuration was used on this launch .
#Text=ProtoStar-1 was launched in the upper position , mated to the Sylda adapter , whilst Badr-6 was in lower position , directly integrated onto the second stage of the carrier rocket .
#Text=ProtoStar-1 separated from the carrier rocket just over 27 minutes after launch , followed by the Sylda adapter about 90 seconds later , and Badr-6 just under 36 minutes into the flight .
#Text=Following confirmation of successful deployment of the satellites , Jean Yves Le Gall , the Chairman and Chief Executive of Arianespace , thanked the launch team for the successful launch .
#Text=He also thanked the European Space Agency , who " by their continuous support of space policy guarantee [ Arianepace 's ] success " .

column1: #Text=Phillip Father , the President of ProtoStar , thanked Arianespace for the launch , and also thanked the " many people who have touched us and helped us out " .
#Text=He also said that he " would like to take this opportunity to thank the families , spouses , and significant others who have supported us " .
#Text=The Badr-6 programme manager stated that " this is a moment of sheer joy and excitement " .
#Text=He also referred to an unofficial Arianespace slogan , " launches speak louder than words " , saying that " we heard you loud and clear " .

#Text=The launch had previously been scheduled for late June , however delays with the previous Ariane launch caused it to be rescheduled for last Friday evening , from where it was delayed in order to replace part of an electrical connection between the rocket and mobile launch platform .
#Text=This was the 34th launch of 2008 , and the fourth to be conducted by an Ariane 5 .
#Text=This marked the 40th launch of an Ariane 5 , and the 15th of the ECA configuration .
#Text=The next Ariane launch is scheduled for early August , with the Superbird 7 and AMC-21 spacecraft .
